div.p: SAME in SOME FEATURES WHEREAS DIFFERENT in OTHER FEATURES.
1. The general, almost copula-like word for resemblance of any kind is yóu 猶 (ant.* yì 異 "be different"), and this word can refer specifically to one item being "no better than" another.
2. Rú 如 is often asymmetrical "be as good>match>resemble essentially>resemble in appearance only" often adds to the notion of resemblance that of equipollence. [ 不如 always: "be not as good as"]
3. Ruò 若 typically expresses a symmetrical relation of things that are similar to each other. By analogy with rú 如 bù ruò 不若 is often "be not as good as" but sometimes also "not resemble".]
4. Sì 似 and the later and rarer colloquial xiàng 像 are often ungrammaticalised full verbs meaning typically "to resemble in appearance only".
5. Lèi 類 (ant. yì 異 "be different in kind") is originally and prototypically "be of the same kind or category>resemble", but comes to mean more generally "be similar".
相似 is the current modern word for resemblance.
似的 shìde is a grammaticalised form referring to resemblance.
相像 (lit) is a less common and more literary word for resemlance.
形似 (lit) focusses on resemblance of external form.
貌似 (lit) focusses on resemblance of appearance.
跟... 一般 focusses on sameness of category.
近似 focusses on closeness of similarity.
相近 refers to similarity figuratively, as mutual closeness.
切近 refers figuratively to close similarity, as closeness.
近乎 refers to similarity figuratively as closeness to something.
接近 refers to similarity figuratively as closely linked closeness to something.
近於 refers to similarity figuratively as closeness to something.
相仿 refers to approximative similarity.
類似 refers to categorial similarity.
類乎 (lit) refers to being similar on grounds of belonging to the same category.
八九不離十 (prov) refers to overwhelming similarity or near-identity.
近似
如同
猶如
好像
好比
差不多
差不離兒
不相上下
相近
類 (cl)
似 (cl)
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／
如 x can work many ways:
祭如神在
視民如子
愛如父 would be ambiguous: 1. love like a father does (a child); 2. love like (a child) does a father.
如故 "as before"

note.p: par is alike and construes similarity from one angle only, from the angle of one of the things compared.

entry.def: Sì 似 and the later and rarer xiàng 像 are ungrammaticalised full verbs meaning typically "to resemble in appearance only".

sense.def: what resembles N, the likes of N
function like; behave like, act like; resemble [be simliar in one's actions, effects and/or achievements]
子期似王"Ziqi resembled the king": look like; be similar in appearance
似不之也"is like not understanding it": resemble
V resembling in so doing the N
resemble (in essence), be like, have the qualities of
SHIJI be externally similar, be similar in appearance (as a shadow to the body of which it is the shadow

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

entry.def: Rú 如 is often asymmetrical "be as good as> resemble" often adds to the notion of resemblance that of equipollence. [不如 always: "be not as good as"]

sense.def: 堅如石"be solid like a stone" 隕如雨"fall like rain" resemble an N in Vi-ing

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: N1 compared to subject of VtoN2

sense.def: 蓋之如天"cover them like Heaven": resemble an N in Vt-ing: to Vt the object like the like the object of Vt1.

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: V1 the same way as V2

sense.def: 好德如好色 in the same way as
如此則動心否乎？if (circumstances, things) are like npro, then S
如農夫之務去草"like a peasant making it his business to remove weeds": like
民如野鹿“The people are like wild deer": be like, look like, act like (what) 何如
於我如浮雲"It is like floating clouds to me": be like, amount to
養民如子"nourish the people like/as you would your own children": like (comparison being with the V-ing of N2, the object of the preceding transitive verb with the V-ing of N1)
如日月之食焉 resemble a fact, situation or action expressed by a nominalised sentence
如土委地 resemble a fact, situation or action expressed by a sentence
有雲如眾赤鳥 being like N2
心如虎狼"His heart is like that of a tiger or a wolf": be like that of; be like that in the time of
如挾纊"feel as if they were quilted garments": feel as if
如虎之室"something like the dwelling of a tiger": something like N1, anything like N1
其如示諸斯乎"It is like showing it here": it is (objectively) like V-ing
事之如孝子之養父母"serve him like a filial son looking after his parents": verb like the subject of NPab{S} is verbing in S

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: N compared with respect to VP-ing

sense.def: 知我者如夫子"someone who understands me as the Master does": N resembles the subject of the VP with respect to VP-ing [Puzzling structure! 待考]

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: N compared to SUBJ of S

sense.def: 人之心不同如其面焉"The minds of men are as different as their faces": the PREDICATING of the subject of S is like that PREDICATING of N> be like [待考]
be like, be along the same lines as
cause (oneself) to resemble a man of superior character
to be just like (something), succeed in reaching a standard (of something)
to be so, to be like this, to be such (stands for verbal predicate)
be like this> be the case
cause contextually determinate object to be so
be like this situation/case> be like the case of S
be like the contextually determinate Npro
so, to such an extent; like this
to be like this, to be such (stands for verbal predicate) cf. 然
get this to work; get things to be like this

entry.def: The general, almost copula-like word for resemblance of any kind is yóu 猶 (ant.* yì 異 "be different"), and this word can refer specifically to one item being "no better than" another.
The general, almost copula-like word for resemblance of any kind is yóu 猶 (ant.* yì 異 "be different"), and this word can refer specifically to one item being "no better than" another.

sense.def: 古猶今也“The present is like the past": copula-like verb: be just like
be just like S (which may have an omitted but understood subject)
利猶干將"be sharp like the Ganjiang sword": (to V) just like (something or somebody else)
是猶使蚊負山"this is like ordering a mosquito to bear a mountain on its back": be like V-ing; be as if V-ing
to verb the understood object N2 like an N1
be like V; be essentially the same as V; be not better or more difficult than V
be like, be just like (of two facts) for 猶
be like S (where S is not nominalised), be just like (of two facts) for 猶
get to resemble; live up to the standards of

entry.def: Ruò 若 typically expresses a symmetrical relation of things that are similar to each other. [不若sometimes: "not resemble".]

sense.def: 操舟如神“handled the boat like a spirit":(V) like the subject N; as competently as the subject N
安之若命"put up with it as with fate":like the (syntactic object) N
be like, act like; resemble; resemble that of N
resemble (oneself)> be the same as before
to V2 in the way one is V1-ing> like, just as
be like N1's contextually determinate feature N2
若形之於影“be like the relation of the shadow to the body": be like Nab
be like V-ing, look like V-ing
君子之交淡如水“Social interactions of a true gentleman are tepid like water": to V like an N

entry.def: Sì 似 and the later and rarer xiàng 像 are ungrammaticalised full verbs meaning typically "to resemble in appearance only".

sense.def: be in accordance with (e.g. virtue); be on the model of
be figuratively close to> be closely similar to, be similar to
live up to the standards of

entry.def: Lèi 類 (ant. yì 異 "be different in kind") is originally and prototypically "be of the same kind or category", but comes to mean more generally "be of similar appearance".

sense.def: be similar to the contextually determinate thing
often abstract and technical vt: look like, merely appear to be; be similar in basic kind; resemble
be silimar to N, be of the same kind as N
(come to) resemble in appearance and nature
be analogous to, be structurally the same as
be like this, be such, be the case
What would S resemble> how about the situation if S?
What is the act of Nab-ing like> How about the act of Nab-ing?
like this [see KARASHIMA 2001, who argues that this frequent idiom looks as if it has be taken in many instances not as "make this..." but as "like this" (=如是).

sense.def: in such a way, like this, in this manner

if it is like this (as defined in S1) (then) S2

entry.def: when one compares [it] [it] is like N

sense.def: Take for example the situation elaborated in the paragraph SS; It is like the situation SS [One could read this as VPt[0]oSS, taking the comparer to be lexically determinate: "one".]
may be properly compared to, be comparable to the case of (typically but not always with understood subject)
may be properly compared with S
譬如為山"It is like building up a mound": It is like V-ing
be comparable to the situation described in S

sense.def: compare the understood N1 to N2!
be like the cases of the sentences SS

may be properly/usefully compared to; One may compare the thing to N. be like like (often preceded by what we take to be a topic rather than a subject, which is picked up referentially by the 之 hidden in 諸)
like this, as V as this
like this, in this way (Yuan Drama)
仲尼日月也"Confucius is like the sun and the moon": marking metaphorical nominal predication: "be like"
is to be compared to, is similar to V-ing
be comparable to the situation as described in S
to V like N (very rare, possibly archaic)
be closely similar to each other
